chapter.title: Work order management in the Endpoints tab
chapter.para: The Endpoints tab area allows you to perform several work order-related functions.

Work orders, once they are created, become jobs in the @@FieldAppName@@, where they become available to technicians who can select them, use them to navigate to job sites, and use them to provision equipment. A user of the @@FieldAppName@@ sees a list of those jobs that are:
Assigned to him or her.
Not closed.
Either set with an appointment start time in the next 24 hours, or have no appointment time set.
xxx Add a glossterm for work orders, too

Using the Endpoints tab, you can:
Create work orders
Query and update work orders
Query work orders

step.para: Click the Endpoints tab, then click Create Work Order in the left panel.
Click the Execute button on the right.
The system communicates with a server and then displays a form on the right.
Fill out the work order information in the form. The following fields are available:

formalpara.title: WO Type
formalpara.para: Select from the available job types (FTTX_REPAIR, ONT_INSTALLATION, ONT_REPLACEMENT).

formalpara.title: WO Severity
formalpara.para: Set the importance of the job.

formalpara.title: ONT Address
formalpara.para: Required. Provide the ONT address address for the job.

formalpara.title: Subscriber ID
formalpara.para: Required. Provide the current subscriber's ID.

formalpara.title: Appointment Start Time
formalpara.para: Provide the appointment start time, as agreed with the subscriber.

formalpara.title: Appointment End Time
formalpara.para: Provide the appointment start time, as agreed with the subscriber.

formalpara.title: Field Tech ID
formalpara.para: Provide the assigned field tech ID.

formalpara.title: WO Details
formalpara.para: A text field for any additional details.

formalpara.title: OLT Address
formalpara.para: Provide the OLT (optical line terminal) address for the job.

formalpara.title: WO Address List
formalpara.para: A list of the (geographic) addresses for this work order. I assume these are geo addresses -- Aaron

formalpara.title: Subscriber Notes
formalpara.para: A text field for notes about the subscriber.

formalpara.title: Job Equipment Inventory
formalpara.para: A list of the required equipment for the job.

formalpara.title: WO Notes
formalpara.para: Special notes for this work order.

step.para: Click the Save Settings button to complete work order creation. To start over, click the Retry button.

section.title: Querying and Updating a Work Order
section.para: The Querying and Updating a Work Order endpoint operation lets you retrieve an existing work order by its job ID, then modify its fields and save the results.

When you click the operation's name, it displays a jobID field; enter the ID and click Execute. Querying and updating a work order: retrieving the work order
After the system retrieves the work order, edit the fields as necessary, then scroll down to click the Save Settings button when done. To query a different work order, click the Retry button. Querying and updating a work order: retrieving the work order

section.title: Querying a Work Order
section.para:
The Query a Work Order endpoint operation allows you to search for work orders that meet specific criteria. When you click the operation's name, the system displays the available search fields: Querying a work order: search fields
Some of the fields list special values, such as the Field Tech ID field, where you can either enter a specific ID to list only work orders assigned to a specific tech, or you can enter NOT ASSIGNED to display work orders that have not been assigned to any field tech.

To perform a query, enter values in the fields, then press the Execute button. The system displays the results in the same pane. To enter a different query, click the Retry button. Querying a work order: results
